a.span: Consolidated Lists of Resources For Students & Parents/Guardians For Use During The School Closure

div.span: Educate and empower all students to maximize their potential as learners and citizens.
Provide an innovative, world-class education that propels each student to grow and succeed.

span.span: Vote, typically held each year on the third Tuesday in May, is hereby postponed until at least June 1, 2020 pursuant to the New York State Governor’s Executive Order 202.13. Further notice will be given when more information is available.

br.span:
The district will be providing meals to our students during our closure, please complete this survey to assist us in preparing meals and coordinating delivery of meals: FCS Food Distribution Survey
Please let us know your families access to technology : FCS Technology Survey

span.strong: United Way of Delaware and Otsego Counties announced the mass food distributions will no longer be open to the public. Due to safety concerns, space and time constraints, the ability to continue serving the community in this manner is "undoable," according to a media release.

br.span: Please see our Employment page for details

span.p: Smart Schools Investment Plan Updated 1/10/2019. In November of 2014, NYS voters approved the Smart Schools Bond Act. This Bond Act provides funding for improvement related to school connectivity and security measures. Franklin Central School received an allocation of $337,323.
